alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Laramie County; East Platte County; Goshen County; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 3:27PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Albany, Goshen, northern Laramie and southern Platte Counties through 400 PM MDT... At 327 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Torrington to 9 miles west of Chugwater. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Torrington, Wheatland, Lingle, La Grange, Chugwater, Yoder, Huntley, Chugcreek, Bordeaux, Y-O Ranch, Hawk Springs, Hawk Springs Campground, Whitaker, Slater, Hawk Springs Recreation Area, Meriden Rest Area and Veteran. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 29 and 78. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Cheyenne.
